docs.snippet: Readers respond to our cover story about the case for the subway with their own stories about riding the mass- transit system.

headline.main: Readers Share Their New York Subway Stories

docs.snippet: The chef at the Beatrice Inn has made her mark with luxurious old-school cooking and a management style that defies toxic restaurant culture.

headline.main: Angie Mar’s Menu: Red Meat and Respect

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s policies are being criticized as India’s hot economy cools. But with society so polarized, his Hindu base still appears solid.

headline.print_headline: Rising Anxiety in India Is Piercing Modi’s Aura of Invulnerability
headline.main: India’s Economic Woes Are Piercing Modi’s Aura of Invulnerability

docs.snippet: In a wide-ranging conversation, the stars discuss President Trump, the fallout from the Harvey Weinstein case and why they hadn’t worked together until “The Post.”

headline.print_headline: Ben and Katharine and Tom and Meryl
headline.main: Meryl Streep and Tom Hanks on the #MeToo Moment and ‘The Post’

docs.snippet: From a penthouse on Central Park, Guo Wengui has exposed a phenomenal web of corruption in China’s ruling elite — if, that is, he’s telling the truth.

headline.main: The Mystery of the Exiled Billionaire Whistle-Blower

docs.snippet: Single and restless on a frigid New Year’s Eve, our writer set out on a New York culture crawl: Cardi B, contra dancing, Bargemusic, a 1990s-themed party and more.
The reality-television competition that began nine years ago has evolved to reflect an era fixated on gender and identity — and the boundary-pushing spirit of its star.

headline.main: Is ‘RuPaul’s Drag Race’ the Most Radical Show on TV?

docs.snippet: The e-commerce giant announced a short list of places that could become home to its second headquarters. The process has garnered the kind of enthusiasm normally reserved for bids to host the Olympics.

headline.print_headline: Where Amazon May Build Its New Headquarters
headline.main: Where Amazon May Build Its New Headquarters

docs.snippet: The conglomerate’s C.E.O., John Flannery, said that he was continuing to consider shifts in the company’s structure. That may not mean a big split.

headline.main: G.E. Weighs Changes, but Investors Hear ‘Breakup’: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: Mr. Bezos is the world’s richest person and can afford virtually any luxury. But obscurity is no longer among them.

headline.main: Jeff Bezos, Mr. Amazon, Steps Out
